title: DeepWork Job Definition
description: Schema for DeepWork job.yml files. Jobs are multi-step workflows executed by AI agents.

name.description: Job name (lowercase letters, numbers, underscores, must start with letter). Example: 'competitive_research'

summary.description: Brief one-line summary of what this job accomplishes. Used in skill descriptions.

common_job_info_provided_to_all_steps_at.description: Common context and information provided to all steps at runtime. Use this for shared knowledge that every step needs (e.g., project background, key terminology, constraints, or conventions) rather than duplicating it in individual step instructions.

workflows.description: Named workflows that group steps into multi-step sequences. Workflows define execution order.

steps.description: List of steps in the job. Each step becomes a skill/command.

stepId.description: Step identifier (lowercase letters, numbers, underscores, must start with letter)

workflow.description: A named workflow grouping steps into a sequence

summary.description: Brief one-line summary of what this workflow accomplishes

steps.description: Ordered list of step entries. Each entry is either a step ID (string) or an array of step IDs for concurrent execution.

oneOf.description: Array of step IDs that can be executed concurrently

step.description: A single Step in a job, representing one material unit of work with evaluatable outputs

id.description: Unique step identifier within this job

name.description: Human-readable display name for the step

description.description: Description of what this step does. Used in skill descriptions.

instructions_file.description: Path to instructions markdown file (relative to job directory). Example: 'steps/research.md'

inputs.description: List of inputs required by this step (user parameters or files from previous steps)

outputs.description: Named outputs produced by this step. Keys are output identifiers, values describe type and purpose. May be empty for cleanup or validation steps.

dependencies.description: List of step IDs this step depends on. Dependencies must complete before this step runs.

hooks.description: Lifecycle hooks for validation and actions at different points in step execution

stop_hooks.description: DEPRECATED: Use hooks.after_agent instead. Legacy stop hooks for quality validation loops.

exposed.description: If true, step is user-invocable in menus/commands. If false, step is hidden (only reachable via workflows or dependencies). Default: false

hidden.description: If true, step is hidden from menus. Alias for exposed: false. Default: false

reviews.description: Quality reviews to run when step completes. Can be empty.

agent.description: Agent type for this step (e.g., 'general-purpose'). When set, the skill uses context forking and delegates to the specified agent type.

userParameterInput.description: A user-provided parameter input that will be requested at runtime

description.description: Description shown to user when requesting this input

fileInput.description: A file input from a previous step's output

file.description: File name to consume from the source step's outputs

from_step.description: Step ID that produces this file. Must be in the dependencies list.

stepOutput.description: Output specification with type information indicating single file or multiple files

type.description: Whether this output is a single file ('file') or multiple files ('files')

description.description: Description of what this output contains

required.description: Whether this output must be provided when calling finished_step. If false, the output is optional and can be omitted.

hooks.description: Lifecycle hooks triggered at different points in step execution

after_agent.description: Hooks triggered after the agent finishes. Used for quality validation loops.

before_tool.description: Hooks triggered before a tool is used. Used for pre-action checks.

before_prompt.description: Hooks triggered when user submits a prompt. Used for input validation.

hookAction.description: A hook action - exactly one of: prompt (inline text), prompt_file (external file), or script (shell script)

prompt_file.description: Path to prompt file (relative to job directory)

script.description: Path to shell script (relative to job directory)

review.description: A quality review that evaluates step outputs against criteria

run_each.description: Either 'step' to review all outputs together, or the name of a specific output to review individually

quality_criteria.description: Map of criterion name to criterion question

additional_review_guidance.description: Optional guidance for the reviewer about what context to look at (e.g., 'Look at the job.yml file for context'). Replaces automatic inclusion of input file contents.
